task.title: How To Set Up Smart Hubs?
task.shortdesc: This topic provides step-by-step instructions for installing and configuring a smart hub, which serves as the central controller for managing connected IoT devices in a smart environment.

image.alt: AI-generated example image of smart hub settings feature

prereq.p: Before setup, check the smart hub’s compatibility with your Wi-Fi band (2.4 GHz vs. 5 GHz) and ensure your connected devices support the same communication protocols (e.g., Zigbee, Z-Wave).

ul.li: Ethernet cable (optional, depending on hub model)
Smartphone or tablet with internet access
Mobile app (available via iOS or Android app stores)

step.info: Remove the smart hub, power adapter, and user manual from the packaging.
Plug the smart hub into a wall outlet using the provided power adapter. Wait for the device to power on fully.
Use an Ethernet cable to connect the smart hub to your router, or follow wireless setup instructions if the hub supports Wi-Fi.
Install the manufacturer’s mobile app on your smartphone or tablet. This app will be used to manage hub settings and devices.

cmd.b: Create or Log In to Your Account

step.info: Open the app and sign in using your existing account or create a new one if required.
Follow the in-app instructions to detect and register the smart hub to your account.
Start pairing your smart lights, thermostats, sensors, and other IoT devices through the app’s device-adding wizard.
Ensure each connected device responds properly to commands issued from the app or hub interface
